ab.title: Numbers 15
ab.l: And the Lord spoketo Moses, saying,
‘Speak to the children of Israel,and say to them, “When you will come to the land of your habitations,which I am giving to you,

And when you will make an offering by fireto the Lord, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice in dedicating a vow or in afreewill offering or on your holidays, to make an aroma of acceptance to the Lord,of the cattle, or of the flock:
Thenthe one who brings forward his offering to the Lord shall bring forward fine flour,the tenth part of an ephah, mixed with the fourth partof a hin of oil.
And you shall make wine for a drink offering,the fourth part of a hin, with the burnt offering orfor sacrifice for one lamb.
Or for a ram, you shall makea grain offering, fine flour, two tenths, mixed with the thirdpart of a hin of oil.
And wine for a drink offering: you shall bring forward the thirdpart of a hin, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.
Andwhen you offer the young of cattle for a burnt offering or for a sacrifice in dedicatinga vow or peace offerings to the Lord:
Then he shall bring forwardwith a young of a cattle a grain offering, fine flour, three tenths, mixedwith half a hin of oil.
And you shall bring forwardfor a drink offering half a hin of wine, an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptanceto the Lord.
Thus shall it be done for one bull or for oneram or for a lamb of the sheep or for a goat.
According to the number that you will do, so shall you do to |each| oneaccording to their number.
All those from this land shall do these things after this manner, to bring forwardan offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.
And ifa stranger lives with you — or the one who is among you — throughout your generations,and offers an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord: as you do,so he shall do, too.
Oh |you|, community, one statuteis for you and for the stranger that lives |with you|, a statutethroughout your generations: as you are, so shall the stranger be before the Lord.
One teaching and one judgement shall be for you andfor the stranger that lives with you.”’
Andthe Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
‘Speak to the childrenof Israel, and say to them, “When you come to the land whereI am bringing you:
And it shall be that before you eatof the bread of the land, you shall dedicate a heave offering to the Lord.
You shall dedicate a cake of the first of your dough as a heave offering. Like a heave offeringof the threshing-floor, so shall you dedicate it.
Of the firstof your dough you shall give to the Lord a heave offering throughout your generations.
And if you make a mistake and do not do all these commandments,which the Lord has spoken to Moses,
Allthat the Lord has commanded you by the prophecy of Moses,from the day that the Lord commanded Moses and onward throughout your generations,

Then it shall be that, if it was done by mistake, out of the |sight of| the superiors of the congregation,then the congregation shall do one calf, the young of the cattle,for a burnt offering, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord, and its grain offering,and its drink offering, according to the |required| manner, and one kid of the goatsfor a sin offering.

And the priest shall ask for atonementfor all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiventhem, because it is a mistake, and they have broughttheir offering, a sacrifice by fire to the Lord, and their sin offeringbefore the Lord for their mistake.
And it shall be forgiven for all the congregation of the children of Israel and the strangerwho lives among them, because for all the peoplethe sin was by mistake.
And if any soul sinsby mistake, then he shall bring forward a one-year-old goat for a sin offering.
And the priest shall ask for atonement for the soulthat is mistaken, when he sins by mistake beforethe Lord, to ask for atonement for him, and it will be forgiven him.
|For| the native among the children of Israel and for the strangerwho lives among them: there shall be one teachingfor you, for the one doing sins by mistake.
Butthe soul that does anything with a strong hand, |whether he is| of the native or of the strangers,he despises the word of the Lord, and that soul will be cut offfrom among his people,
Because he has despised the word of the Lordand has broken his commandment. That soul shall utterly be cut off:the punishment of his iniquity is on him.”’
Andthe children of Israel were in the wilderness, and they found a manthat gathered wood on the Sabbath day.
Andthose who found him gathering sticks brought him forwardto Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation.
And they put him under guard, because it was not yet declared whatdeath should be done to him.
And the Lord said to Moses,‘The man shall be surely put to death. All the congregation shall stone him with stonesoutside the camp.’
Andall the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned himwith stones, and he died, as the Lord commanded Moses.
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Speak to the children of Israel, and you shall say to them thatthey shall make themselves tassels in the edges of their garmentsthroughout their generations, and that they shall put on the tassel of the edgesa thread of blue.

And it shall be to you that you may look on itand see, and remember all the commandments of the Lord anddo them, and that you shall not turn after your own heart and your own eyes,after which you go astray:
Thatyou may remember and do all my commandments,and be holy to your God.
I am the Lordyour God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt,to be God to you. I am the Lord your God.’
